question: What are the targets of Mosunetuzumab?
ideal_answer: Mosunetuzumab is an anti-CD20/CD3 T-cell engaging bispecific antibody, is being developed by Roche for the treatment of relapsed or refractory follicular lymphoma.

snippets.text: They combine two different monospecific antigen-binding regions that target CD20 on B cells and engage T cells via CD3 in a 1:1 or 2:1 CD20:CD3 antigen binding fragment (Fab) format. The results of different phase 1 trials with BsAbs, including mosunetuzumab, glofitamab, epcoritamab and odeonextamab, have been recently published.
Mosunetuzumab (Lunsumio®), an anti-CD20/CD3 T-cell engaging bispecific antibody, is being developed by Roche for the treatment of relapsed or refractory follicular lymphoma.
BACKGROUND: Mosunetuzumab is a CD20 × CD3 T-cell-engaging bispecific monoclonal antibody that redirects T cells to eliminate malignant B cells. I
However, several CD20 × CD3 BsAbs including odronextamab, mosunetuzumab, glofitamab, and epcoritamab emerged recently.
